;Sitabile Dewa 结婚时对性生活很满意，但离婚后发现自己获得性快感的前景相当黯淡。

;

;在社会保守的津巴布韦，离婚妇女和单身母亲常常被视为男人不受欢迎的伴侣，在沮丧中，德瓦决定使用性玩具。

;

; p>;

;然而，性玩具在津巴布韦是违法的。

;

;“我不应该被剥夺自我探索和自我满足的权利，”35 岁的 Dewa 说。

;

;津巴布韦的“审查和娱乐控制”法律的一部分规定进口或拥有性玩具为非法，因为它们被视为“不雅”或“淫秽”并有害于公共道德。拥有性玩具可能会让女性入狱。

;

;Dewa 表示，这项法律“过时”，并在法庭上对其中的部分内容提出质疑，因为该法律具有压制性并侵犯了她的自由。她于三月份向法庭提交文件，起诉津巴布韦政府，并寻求废除部分法律。法院正在审理她的案件。

;

;她对手淫和女性性行为的大胆、公开的提及肯定会让许多津巴布韦人感到不舒服。

;

;但女权活动人士表示，她的改革意义重大，作为对国家父权观念更广泛挑战的一部分，妇女在影响她们及其身体的一系列其他问题上的选择——包括避孕、婚姻，甚至她们的穿着——受到审查，而且往往受到限制。

;

;Dewa 本人就是一名女权活动家，并表示她运用自己的生活经历来反对性玩具禁令。

;

;去年，两名妇女因性玩具禁令而被捕，证明该法律得到了积极执行。性玩具。

;

;其中一个正在经营一家在线企业，向女性销售性辅助工具并提供使用建议。她被拘留了两周，并被判处六年监禁或 640 小时无偿社区工作。

;

;在性玩具问题上，最让当局愤怒的是男性的边缘化，说。黛布拉·姆瓦斯 (Debra Mwase) 是津巴布韦妇女权利游说组织 Katswe Sistahood 的项目经理。她说，性解放的女性令主导津巴布韦政治、社会和文化空间的男性感到恐惧。

;

;“性并不真正被视为女性的事情，”姆瓦斯说。 “性是男人享受的。对于女性来说，它仍然被认为是生育的必需品。”

;

;“没有男人的性行为会成为一种威胁，”她补充道。

;

;Dewa 将其归结为：“这些如果大多数用户是男性，法律早就被废除了。”她说。

;

;津巴布韦的历史也很重要。虽然我们无法弄清楚殖民主义可能对当今撒哈拉以南非洲地区的妇女权利产生的影响，但多项研究表明，在欧洲法律、文化和宗教强加之前，非洲妇女的性表达能力要强得多。

;

;乌干达著名学者西尔维娅·拉梅尔（Sylvia Ramale）在她编辑的一本名为《非洲性行为》（African Sexualities）的书的序言中写道，前殖民时代的非洲女性在性行为方面“相对不受约束”。拉马莱说，一方面，他们穿着暴露的衣服。

;

;泰国政党试图通过性玩具选举承诺来引起选民的兴趣

;

;但殖民主义及其所携带的外国宗教“强调与女性身体相关的不洁性和固有的罪恶，”她说。

;

;Mwase 打趣道，她认为津巴布韦现在的情况是一个巨大的讽刺，该国 43 年来一直独立且不受少数白人统治的压迫。多年来，仍然保留了诸如处理性玩具之类的法律，这是从殖民时代遗留下来的。

;

;“非洲社会仍然大力执行被那些将他们带到这里的人早已抛弃的价值观和法律。在欧洲，女性现在可以自由地穿更少的衣服，并且在性方面也很自由，就像我们一个多世纪前所做的那样。”她说。

;

;Dewa 争取获得性玩具的运动具有更大的意义。她说，津巴布韦的妇女“厌倦了压迫”，而且显然具有前瞻性。但最近有证据表明，回到过去可能也会受到欢迎。

;

;在《爱经》的土地上，随着态度的转变，初创企业帮助卧室增添情趣

;

;一些前殖民时期南部非洲传统的一部分“Chinamwari”正在复兴，年轻女性聚集在一起参加性教育课程，由来自家庭或社区的年长女性监督。

;

;从前戏到性姿势等各种建议。性健康和生殖健康的宣传活动给 Chinamwari 带来了不雅的名声，但也有可能赋予年轻女性权力。

;

;在现代的津巴布韦，Chinamwari 会议会在互联网上做广告。但现在它们也有了保密的保证，这主要是因为人们对性的普遍态度以及一些男性的强烈反对，他们对女性太擅长性的想法感到不安。

;随着阿富汗塔利班重新掌权，人们越来越担心极端主义活动。分析人士称，最近建立的反恐对话机制反映了邻国巴基斯坦和伊朗加深与中国安全关系的担忧和愿望。 “新敌人”——正试图修补两国之间严重破裂的关系，希望增强各自的反恐能力，以避免溢出效应。

;

;“从中国的角度来看，这个问题一直是最令人担忧的问题新加坡南洋理工大学国际政治暴力和恐怖主义研究中心高级研究员拉斐尔·潘图奇 (Raffaello Pantucci) 表示，事实上，你看到越来越多的不同群体将中国视为敌人。

;

;潘图奇表示，蔑视的范围已从主要是维吾尔族武装分子扩大到巴基斯坦的分裂主义和圣战组织，这些组织在动员人力和资源时瞄准了中国在该地区的利益。

;

;“这也是“中国认为，如果巴基斯坦和伊朗和睦相处，他们将把重点放在中国担心的威胁上，而不是相互冲突。”他说。

;

;最近，中国宣布将开始定期反制与巴基斯坦和伊朗举行反恐会谈“以解决恐怖分子的跨境流动”，这是与这两个国家的首次此类对话，这两个国家因长期争端而持续发生边界冲突。

;

;该地区自2021年美国撤出驻阿富汗剩余部队后，塔利班重新掌权以来，阿富汗面临着日益频繁的恐怖活动。

;

;“时机微妙”：为什么布林肯的沙特阿拉伯之行是“向中国传递信息”

;

; h3>;

;自从塔利班重新建立组织以来，据报道，包括维吾尔族东突厥斯坦伊斯兰运动 (ETIM) 和巴基斯坦俾路支解放军 (BLA) 在内的分裂主义组织已开始在国内巩固其势力——这些叛乱分子类型中国是最令人担忧的。

;

;这些组织在巴基斯坦俾路支省尤其活跃，引发了与该省接壤的巴基斯坦和伊朗以及中国的担忧，中国的人员和项目位于巴基斯坦俾路支省。该地区经常成为针对的目标。

;

;中国已在该地区建立了重要的基础设施项目，其中包括瓜达尔港，它是中国更广泛的“一带一路”倡议下耗资 600 亿美元的中巴经济走廊的一部分。< /p>;

;2021 年，瓜达尔港发生自杀式炸弹袭击，袭击目标是中国公民，造成两人死亡，北京敲响了警钟。该地区的暴力和不稳定局势，BLA 声称对此负责。清华大学一带一路研究中心外交政策分析师兼研究员佐恩·艾哈迈德·汗表示，这促使北京“首先建立预防机制，以便巴基斯坦和伊朗也能更好地保护自己免受来自阿富汗领土的恐怖威胁”。道路战略研究所。

;

;对话还旨在让巴基斯坦和伊朗走到一起，协调“巴基斯坦-伊朗边境日益增长的武装活动”——这是加强信任和为未来做好准备的第一步汗补充说，这也涉及阿富汗。

;

;由于巴基斯坦武装分子沿着伊朗锡斯坦和俾路支省与巴基斯坦之间的共同边界发动跨境袭击，巴基斯坦和伊朗关系变得紧张。

;

;汗承认，尽管有共同意向，但与塔利班政府的合作是“具有挑战性的”，与喀布尔当局的进一步协调将是北京的“中长期战略”。

;

; p>;

;中国、伊朗、巴基斯坦同意将反恐会谈变成常态

;

;上个月，中国、巴基斯坦和阿富汗外长首次会面，这是塔利班掌权后的首次2021 年 8 月，中国总理秦刚在喀布尔表示，北京对“中国公民、机构和项目”的安全感到担忧。

;

;三方随后发表联合声明，强调需要“和平、安全”稳定和繁荣的阿富汗”，这需要威慑恐怖活动，并强调来自巴基斯坦塔利班运动 (TTP) 和东突厥斯坦伊斯兰运动 (ETIM) 的威胁。

;

;“[但是]塔利班尽管有人直接提出要求，但未能打击 TTP、BLA 以及其他在中巴经济走廊方面直接威胁中国和巴基斯坦的组织。”汗说。

;

;北京在与塔利班政权的接触中开始采取更加谨慎的态度。其在阿富汗最大的投资之一梅斯艾纳克铜矿因局势不稳定已暂停多年。

;

;南洋理工大学反恐专家潘图奇表示，北京与中国之间几乎没有任何信任。喀布尔，从他们最近的外交互动中传递出的“明确信息”就可以看出。

;

;中阿巴三方外长对话后的第二天，中国外交部发言人汪文斌强调了第一个“书面承诺，不允许“东伊运”等势力实施恐怖行动和活动”，并补充说，“这对中阿关系的未来发展具有重要意义”。

;

;“事实上，他们不得不[对此发表重要意见]对我说他们很担心。 [而且]这不会发生，”他说。

;

;潘图奇说，这项新举措也是北京改善与德黑兰关系的尝试。他说：“[伊朗]可能是他们在[恐怖主义]这一特定问题上安全关系最不牢固的国家”。

;

;事实上，中国和伊朗正式敦促阿富汗终止对阿富汗的限制。潘图奇表示，尽管存在激怒塔利班的风险，但妇女权利问题“反映了双方的真正担忧，也希望双方共同考虑合作”，他指的是中国国家主席习近平会晤后发布的联合声明。习近平和伊朗总统易卜拉欣·莱西二月在北京。

;

;在联合声明中，两国还“就进一步反恐合作达成一致”，并表示愿意“建立双边反恐磋商机制”。

;

;中国在增加对该地区的投资的同时，一直在推动和平解决方案，包括促成伊朗和沙特阿拉伯之间的和平协议，并表示准备协助以色列和巴勒斯坦之间的和平努力。

;<此次（三边）对话发生在中东和南亚外交发生重大变化之际。新加坡国立大学中东分校高级研究员 Jean-Loup Samaan 表示：“当地国家正在通过亚伯拉罕协议、内盖夫论坛或 I2U2 等新的（美国主导的）倡议，加强双边和多边的经济和安全参与。”研究所。

;

;但是，他表示，尽管此类会谈建立了“地区势头”，但它们很难对抗美国与该地区阿拉伯国家的倡议。

;

;尽管如此，中国中国西北大学教授严伟表示，中国的目标不是“领导”地区安全力量，而是试图满足三个国家的共同需求。

;

;“ [巴基斯坦、伊朗或邻国]国家与中国关系密切，因为它们是“一带一路”倡议和中巴经济走廊的重要国家，甚至是核心国家。”严说。

;

;

;普京谴责这次叛乱是叛国罪，并发誓要惩罚肇事者，指责他们将俄罗斯推向内战的边缘，然后才接受一项迅速拼凑的协议，以避免莫斯科最严重的安全危机国家控制的电视台主播将结束危机的协议视为普京智慧的展示，并播放了瓦格纳集团军队从俄罗斯南部顿河畔罗斯托夫撤退的镜头。

;

; p>;

;叛乱是在乌克兰反攻的背景下展开的，瓦格纳的军队在这场战争中持续了数月的时间里部署了一些地区。

;

;

;中国农业部门为有关在山区种植水稻的有争议的研究进行了辩护，称该国必须充分利用山坡地，确保粮食安全。

;

;农业农村部周五在其官方报纸《农民日报》上发表文章称，山地种植水稻是中国最重要的主粮尽管产量较低、成本较高，但还是值得探索的。

;

;“目前，为了保障粮食安全，我们不仅要在这样的土地上种植农作物，而且要保证种好。” unnamed ministry official from a land protection centre was quoted as saying.

;

;The comments were in response to criticism of Zhu Youyong, a member of the China Academy of Engineering, who has developed rice varieties that can grow in dry farmland instead of flooded paddy fields.

;

;Zhu has suggested that such varieties could be grown on hillsides, which account for about 22 per cent of the country's farmland.

;

;His experiments have been carried out in mountainous areas in Yunnan province in the country's southwest.

;

;China's new rural law force accused of strong-arm tactics against farmers

;

;China has embarked on a national campaign to ensure food security , in part by creating new arable land.

;

;Food security has become a matter of national security in recent years amid worsening ties with the West and the war in Ukraine.

;

;In some cases , local governments have converted forests and parkland into cropland to meet the target.

;

;But critics say that using such land to grow crops risks degrading the soil.

;

;Rice farmer Ding Yong, who has spent the past two decades growing the crop in central China's Hunan province, said cases of land misuse were not rare.

;

;He said that in Guiyang county, an area of 200 hectares (494 acres) of hillside had been cleared of trees but nothing had been planted.

;

;“Their goal was to create a certain size of farmland. They spent a lot of money on building terraces, but paid little attention to improving soil fertility or what to plant,” he said.

;

;“The fields also lacked strong walls, so when there's heavy rain, the terraces will definitely be ruined.”

;

;In recent decades, rapid industrialisation and urbanisation have eaten into the amount of land available for farming.

;

;But that trend has reversed a little over the past two years amid tough government measures to curb land loss, according to the results of the annual land-use survey by the Ministry of Natural Resources.

;

;The country had about 200 million hectares of farmland as of the end of last year, with 87,000 hectares added in 2022 and 80,000 hectares in 2021, it said.

;

;“Protect farmland like we do pandas. Make every inch of land a source of harvest,” read a slogan on the ministry's website to observe China's National Land Day on Sunday.

;;

;An influencer in China who claimed to be a Russian soldier fighting in the war in Ukraine has been exposed as a fraud, igniting fierce debate on mainland social media.

;

;The influencer, known by his online alias “Pavel Korchatie”, gained more than 380,000 followers on the short video app Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok, where he shared his “first-hand” experience of the war in Mandarin, according to news portal HK01.

;

;His videos typically started with a greeting to viewers in Mandarin – “Hello, friends from China” – followed by his personal stories from the war, which inspired many social media users to cheer on the Russian troops.

;

;In one video, he was shown standing in front of a power plant boldly claiming to have captured Ukrainian prisoners.

;

;“We are currently engaged in a life-and-death battle with the Ukrainian army,” he said.

;

;He also boasted about fighting US Navy Seals, shooting down US military drones, and even taunted the US military by saying: “We blew up your tanks, let's see if you are still tough.”

;

;As his audience grew, he started an e-commerce business through a Douyin online store where he offered a range of Russian specialties including honey, beer and vodka. He received more than 200 orders.

;

;However, eagle-eyed observers challenged the soldier's claims, saying he was actually a Chinese man using filters to impersonate a Russian fighter with the aim of promoting and selling products online.

;

;Their evidence was substantial.

;

;For instance, the IP addresses displayed in his videos were mostly from central China's Henan province, and he spoke Mandarin with a strong Henan accent.

;

;The purported Ukrainian nuclear power plant featured in the video also turned out to be a power station in Luoyang, a city in Henan, and the cars seen in the background of the video had mainland Chinese number plates.

;

;After being exposed, he simply renamed his account “Wang Kangmei”, meaning “Wang Anti-America”, and called himself the “Vanguard Against America” in his account bio – all in an attempt to continue exploiting nationalistic sentiments to gain traffic.

;

;Douyin banned his account on June 16 for disseminating false information.

;

;He managed to deceive many online users, with some saying: “Salute to the hero, thumbs up!” and “He speaks Chinese so well!”

;

;Others called for better content moderation on the social media platform, saying the soldier was an obvious fraud.

;

;“After watching his original videos, who would believe that a person with a Henan accent is a Russian soldier?” said one commenter.

;

;Some pointed out the possible political repercussions of his hoax.

;

;“By claiming to have captured American soldiers, he was implying that the US military was directly involved in the war. Did he understand the potential consequences of his words?” one observer said.

;

;It is not the first time a Chinese influencer has pretended to be a foreigner to gain online popularity.

;

;In 2022, social media observers raised doubts about an influencer named “Russian Nana”, whom they accused of being a Chinese man impersonating a Russian woman by using face-swapping technology.

;

;The influencer had more than 2 million Douyin followers and used his popularity on the platform to boost e-commerce sales.

;Vietnam's Ministry of Foreign Affairs on May 25 called for China to withdraw a survey ship and its coastguard escorts from the nation's exclusive economic zone. While the ship left earlier this month, others have reportedly returned to the disputed waters.

;

;Carl Thayer, professor emeritus at the University of New South Wales and specialist on Vietnamese defence, said while the USS Ronald Reagan's visit was likely to have been planned far in advance, current events at sea had made its arrival particularly timely.

;

;“China's stepped-up assertiveness in Vietnamese waters in May to June no doubt reinforced a convergence of views in Hanoi and Washington that the visit of the USS Ronald Reagan was timely for the signal it would send to Beijing,” said Thayer, adding that China hoped its increased presence near oil and gas fields would pressure Vietnam to desist from its drilling and exploration.

;

;“China is asserting its claims to sovereignty by physically sailing near oil exploration blocks where Russian oil companies Zarubezhneft and Gazprom are active,” he said.

;

;Such tactics, Thayer pointed out, had worked in the past.

;

;Vietnam twice forced the Spanish energy company Repsol to scrap offshore drilling projects in 2017 and 2018 under Chinese pressure. In 2019, a months-long standoff took place between the Chinese coastguard and drillers working on a joint Russian-Vietnamese venture. Rosneft, the Russian state oil company working at the site, eventually withdrew from the field.

;

;“Beijing's actions are part of a long-term strategy to force foreign oil companies from operating in Malaysian, Philippine and Vietnamese waters claimed by China,” said Thayer.

;

;Vietnam was “always vigilant” with regard to Chinese activities in the South China Sea, including the possibility of open warfare, Doanh said, adding that Hanoi also considered “options to deal with China's infringements of sovereignty, including the worst one”.

;

;South China Sea: Asean to hold first joint military drills amid China tensions

;

;The consensus in Hanoi, however, was that a naval war in the South China Sea was extremely unlikely in the coming years, said Cuong, who added that China did not currently have the bandwidth for a war with its southern neighbour.

;

;“It is scientifically predicted that in the next four to five years, it is very unlikely that a military conflict at sea between Vietnam and China will happen because China still has a lot of problems to be resolved domestically as well as externally,” Cuong said.

;

;Chinese harassment at sea, he added, remained Vietnam's primary maritime threat.

;

;“China's use of coastguard ships, oil and gas exploration ships, and maritime militia ships to violate Vietnam's exclusive economic zone is still common,” he said.

;Hollywood producer Arnon Milchan was due to testify on Sunday at Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial to answer questions about an alleged “supply line” of champagne and cigars funnelled to the Israeli leader and his wife said to have been in exchange for help with Milchan's personal and business needs.

;

;Milchan, appearing by videoconference from Brighton, England, near where he is based, is a key witness whose testimony is essential for prosecutors who are trying to prove that Netanyahu committed fraud and breach of trust in one of three cases brought against him.

;

;Prosecutors hope Milchan's testimony, which extends through this week and next, will paint a picture of plush favours granted to Netanyahu and his wife that allegedly spurred the Israeli leader to use his position of power to advance Milchan's interests. The defence will try to lay out their case that Netanyahu was not acting in Milchan's personal interests and that the gifts were just friendly gestures.

;

;Prosecution and defence lawyers will question Milchan from a hotel conference room in Brighton.虽然不允许记者出席，但内塔尼亚胡的妻子萨拉正在对英国进行私人访问，她将旁听米尔坎的证词。 His testimony will be aired in a Jerusalem courtroom for the judges, journalists and other attendees.

;

;According to the indictment, Milchan, whose production credits include such hits as Pretty Woman and 12 Years a Slave, gave Netanyahu and his wife boxes of cigars and crates of champagne over a period of several years that, along with jewellery, amounted to a value of nearly US$200,000 – what the indictment describes as a “supply line” of lavish gifts.

;

;The indictment accuses Netanyahu of using his influential perch to assist Milchan to secure a US visa extension by drawing on his diplomatic contacts, among them former Secretary of State John Kerry. Prosecutors also accuse Netanyahu of working to push legislation that would have granted Milchan millions in tax breaks.

;

;“Considering the many links between the defendant Netanyahu and Milchan, the defendant Netanyahu should have entirely avoided dealing with Milchan's affairs,” the indictment says.

;

;Milchan is testifying in one of three cases being brought against Netanyahu. The other two, for which he is charged with bribery, fraud and breach of trust, accuse Netanyahu of exchanging regulatory favours with powerful media moguls for more positive coverage.

;

;Netanyahu, who is expected to attend some of Milchan's hearings, denies wrongdoing, claiming he is the victim of a witch hunt orchestrated by a liberal media and a biased justice system.

;

;Netanyahu's legal woes have dogged him politically, putting his fitness to rule while on trial at the centre of a political crisis that sent Israelis to the polls for five times in under four years.

;

;They also have fuelled accusations by critics that Netanyahu is pushing a contentious government plan to overhaul Israel's judiciary as a way to escape the charges. Netanyahu denies those charges.

;

;The trial, which began in 2020 and has still not heard from Netanyahu himself, has featured more than 40 prosecution witnesses, including some of Netanyahu's closest former confidants who turned against the premier.

;Witness accounts have shed light not only on the three cases but also revealed sensational details about Netanyahu's character and his family's reputation for living off the largesse of taxpayers and wealthy supporters. ;The idea of a plea bargain has repeatedly surfaced, but prosecutors for now appear determined to see through the trial, despite reports last week that the judges warned them that the more serious crime of bribery will be hard to prove.
